title: PowerShell MCP VS Code Configuration Setup
body: PowerShell MCP .vscode/mcp.json configuration defines 5 server variants: powershell-enterprise (primary enterprise server: dist/server.js), powershell-minimal (debug handshake: dist/minimalServer.js), powershell-vscode-enterprise (debugging source tree: dist/vscode-server-enterprise.js in development directory), powershell-vscode-enterprise-prod (production commands: dist/vscode-server-enterprise.js in production directory c:\github\jagilber\powershell-mcp-server-prod), powershell-mcp-server (legacy compatibility alias). All servers use stdio transport with node command, common debug flags (--disable-self-destruct, --mcp-init-debug 1), and TypeScript compilation to dist/ JavaScript. Configuration enables development/production separation with independent directory structures for risk isolation, version management, and environment-specific deployments. VS Code MCP client connects to appropriate server based on use case: development testing vs production command execution.
